metadata.title: CVE-2012-2269 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in ownCloud before3.0.3 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via (1)an arbitrary field to apps/contacts/ajax/addcard.php, (2) the parameterparameter to apps/contacts/ajax/addproperty.php, (3) the name parameter toapps/contacts/ajax/createaddressbook, (4) the file parameter tofiles/download.php, or the (5) name, (6) user, or (7) redirect_urlparameter to files/index.php.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-2269` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

owncloud - 4.0.7debian-1ubuntu1
owncloud-mysql - 4.0.7debian-1ubuntu1
owncloud-pgsql - 4.0.7debian-1ubuntu1
owncloud-sqlite - 4.0.7debian-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: owncloud package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.7debian-1ubuntu1').
